text: Hi, I'm facing issue in date when creating a deal, The deal `createdate` showing y'day instead of today, Eg, Given date 2024-01-28, But in HubSpot deal `createdate` showing 2024-01-27

Yeah I tried it with the librabry as well and the didnt work. Managed to get it fixed however. The issue was fastify returned that the protocol was http even though it was https, hardcoding it in fixed the issue
Thx <@U06F0VD6S2G> but I’m not quite following. We already have a private app. How might I access the logs using the private app token?

Hi Kunal, I did not find a YouTube video that was helpful. What I did find EXTREMELY helpful though is the documentation such as this (I gave go the example for Customer). <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies?uuid=da93e751-4558-410e-82cf-de70a3c0951f|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies?uuid=da93e751-4558-410e-82cf-de70a3c0951f>

If you hop over to the "Endpoints" tab you can see all the API endpoints available and you can test them by creating a private app in a developer HubSpot instance. It's all of the officially documented CRM endpoints set up for you to test using their SDK.
I am more familiar with Python and I had some issues with the SDK so I ended up using the Requests library in Python to knock out the tasks I had.

Hey guys, I'm running an export from the export api and when I go to read it, instead of a csv, it's a csv within a zip file. I need to deal with this programmatically and not have to manually open and read contents, how do I do this?
what's the timezone in your portal? I believe api dates are in UTC, not in portal timezone or user timezone

Can you give your current example code and what the execution path is? Two possibilities come to mind: you may want to investigate JSON data from a different endpoint Or you could save the file path of your export and use (for example if you are using Python) the extractall() function and use some various other file handling mucking about.

I would recommend the 1st path unless you have a very large amount of data you are working with. In which case it may still make sense. Not that familiar with endpoint timeouts / performance. Would need to investigate that.

Does anyone know if you can return a row from HubDB without specifying a column? I have a search bar that I want to allow searching in multiple columns but there’s no support for ‘OR’ in the query url
